benchmark_details.name: Dynamic Adversarial Question Generation Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces a new dataset of adversarially authored questions aimed at improving the performance of question answering models by utilizing dynamic adversarial question generation techniques.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a dataset that facilitates the generation of challenging questions for question answering models, leveraging dynamic adversarial techniques.

data.source: Adversarially authored questions created using an interactive interface with guidance from LLMs and retrieval models.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by authors to improve question quality and adversarial nature.

methodology.calculation: Metrics based on Item Response Theory (IRT) used to derive parameters that assess question quality.
methodology.interpretation: Questions with higher discriminability and suitable difficulty levels are considered better adversarial examples.
methodology.validation: Validation through competitions between human authors and AI models.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The study was pre-monitored by an official IRB review board to protect the participantsâ€™ privacy rights.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Consent forms displayed before task completion to ensure participants agree to data usage for academic purposes.
